. The Supreme Council of Antiquities of Egypt head Zahi Hawass said that the 3,300-year-old statute should be given back to Egypt. His request was backed by Prime Minister Ahmed Nazif and Culture Minister Faruq Hosni. This request is a natural consequence of Egypt's long-standing policy of seeking the restitution of all archaeological and historical artifacts that have been taken illicitly out of the country, the statement read, according to Reuters.
